author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
A tarnished crown doth the Swedish bear,
Feeling the Euro's relentless glare.
By Riksbank's hand, rates are spun,
Yet market hopes, undone, undone.

Upon the tides of fortune's creed,
Crude oil's chances do recede.
With interest high, the flames may wane,
Stalling the black sea's rich domain.

Last, behold the dollar's might, 
Turning e'en metal's luster slight.
Hawkish day doth cast its pall,
On precious gold and copper's thrall.

feedItems.title: Swedish Krona Falls to Multi-Year Low Vs Euro After Riksbank Raises Rates by 25Bps
feedItems.description: The Swedish krona fell to its weakest level in more than a decade after the Riksbank raised its policy rate by 25 basis points to 3.75%, disappointing some in the market who had anticipated a 50bp rise.

feedItems.title: Oil Edges Lower; U.S. Crude Stocks Slump
feedItems.description: Crude futures inched lower as investors took profits following Wednesday’s sharp run-up, but investors remained concerned about the impact of rising interest rates on oil demand.

feedItems.title: Metals Sour as Dollar Rises on Central-Bank Hawkishness
feedItems.description: Base metals and gold edged lower, with the economic environment turning more bearish “via a strong dollar, softer inflation expectations, and weaker commodity currencies,” Peak Trading Research said.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Thou art Casino, indebted beast of burden,
In nature's court, no gold can ill be pardon.
Convert thy owes, to thy capital's bay,
Lest thou lose thy grocer's sway.

Clothier H&M, swift as a hare,
Behold thy earnings, scant and barely fair,  
Yet in June's frolic does the dove sing,
Thy coin-purse grows under cost's wing.

Oh, Renault, hare of the open field,
Thy fates to the Tradesman's eyes, they yield.
Arise in margin, and cash in thy might,
In the year of the Lord, twenty-twenty's night.

feedItems.title: Casino Proposes Debt Restructuring
feedItems.description: Casino said it would be necessary to convert debt totaling around €5 billion into capital in order to have a structure compatible with its business plan, and would mean Rallye losing control of the grocer.

feedItems.title: H&M's Mixed 2Q Saw Gross Margin Miss But Ebit Beat and Strong June
feedItems.description: H&M B shares opened up 8% after the retailer posted second-quarter earnings, with gross margin slightly below expectations but EBIT well ahead, due to better-than-expected cost control and good trading in June, RBC Capital Markets said.

feedItems.title: Renault Upgrades Outlook
feedItems.description: Renault said its trading had been better than expected as it revised its 2023 operating margin to 7-8% and its automotive operational free cash flow to at least €2.5 billion.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Alas now speaketh new decree across the sea,
Of wares upon the shoals of commerce, must bear the virtue of the tree.
Hark, for each stout oaken blessing, each bean of morning's brew,
Must no hand of devastation darkly upon forests strew.

Praises sing for summer's herald, clad in H&M's glory,
Its coffers swell with season's stories, heated days retold in inventory.
Profit's sweet song echoeth under the sun's advance,
Whilst summer's pattern in threads entwoon enchant the monetary dance.

Bonds of Eurozone do flutter, twisting in the market's gyre,
Upon German's fateful number, investors' pulse set fire.
The yield curve may yet bend, under the weight of data's surprise,
An echoing promise, a note of caution in the future's guise.

feedItems.title: U.S. Companies Face EU Deforestation Rules on Coffee, Wood and More
feedItems.description: Businesses selling everyday products such as leather shoes, coffee and chocolate in the EU will soon need to prove their wares aren’t causing forest loss under a new law, after voluntary efforts largely failed.

feedItems.title: H&M Posts Profit Beat, Sees Good Start to Summer
feedItems.description: H&M said its fiscal third quarter got off to a good start thanks to well-received summer collections after it posted second-quarter profits ahead of forecast.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Rise as Upside Risks Seen in German CPI Data
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields edged higher, with the focus on German inflation data, said UniCredit Research, which expects to see yield curve flattening if the CPI surprises to the upside.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In the ale-house of finance, Powell the wise did say,
‘Tis time to guard the coffers, keep the scoundrels at bay;
Like a brewmaster discerning, proposals he'll see,
Strong regulation, supervision, thus be the decree.

O diverging rates of interest, make the Yen go astray,
Like wine continued pouring, its value doth decay;
Japan's realm, its worth in gold, soon may take a fall,
Analysts foretell, the weakest coin of all.

Brazen Netanyahu, his plan he doth remake,
Like an ale too bitter, a part he chose to take;
No power to challenge Court's say, the ruling he doth curb,
In the tavern of justice, the voice of many disturb.

feedItems.title: Jerome Powell Says Bank Failures Underscore Need for Stronger Regulation, Supervision
feedItems.description: The Fed chair says he “looks forward to evaluating proposals for such changes.”

feedItems.title: Analysis: Yen May Weaken Further as Interest Rates Diverge
feedItems.description: The yen may weaken more in coming months on expectations that the interest-rate gap between Japan and most other countries could widen further and hurt the Japanese currency, analysts said.

feedItems.title: Netanyahu said he would drop one of the most controversial parts of his plan to remake Israel's court system, stripping it of a provision that would have given the national legislature the power to overturn Supreme Court rulings.
feedItems.description: Netanyahu said he would drop one of the most controversial parts of his plan to remake Israel’s court system, stripping it of a provision that would have given the national legislature the power to overturn Supreme Court rulings.
